result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Whittle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

--no direct or indirect contact with Bruce Hady II 

--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate by the Agent 

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--to take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by a treating prescriber

--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without the express written permission of the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening 

--to comply with DNA sample provision

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L Whittle

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: w/ elements and ccs

[MK] cases #21CF353, #22CF92 called at 11:32am 
Defendant Jacob L Whittle in court with Attorney Peter Anderson.  ADA Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered in Case #21CF353-Count #2, and in Case #22CF92-Count #2; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

in Case #21CF353-Count #2, and in Case #22CF92-Count #2 each, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Whittle on Probation for 5 years with conditions:
--as to Case #21CF353-Count #2 only: to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on November 20, 2022 at 8:00pm. The Court allows transfer of the service of the jail term to a border county in the State of Illinois conditional on the jail term being served under the same conditions as would occur in the Jefferson County Jail, including that there is not to be any use of electronic monitoring. Mr. Whittle is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening 
--no direct or indirect contact with Bruce Hady II 
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by a treating prescriber
--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without the express written permission of the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs and surcharges
--as to Case #21CF353-Count #2: to pay drug testing fees of $25, joint and several with the co-actor 

Days credit for time already served in case #21CF353: 3 days
Days credit for time already served in case #22CF92:  0  days

In case #21CF353: the Court orders a six month drivers license suspension. 
The Court requires Mr. Whittle to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 3:00pm today.  
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warning are given.  
recess 12:07pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[MK] cases #21CF353, #21CF354, #22CF90, #22CF92 called at 9:52am 
Co-Defendant Bruce D Hady in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.
Co-Defendant Jacob L. Whittle in court with Attorney Peter Anderson
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #22CF90  (Hady) Prelim-Waiver is held: 
--Mr. Hady waives his right to Preliminary Hearing.  The Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial 

In both Case #22CF90 (Hady) and #22CF92 (Whittle) Arraignment is held: 
--Service of Information is admitted by each Co-Defendant; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
--In Case #22CF90(Hady)  Plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in Case #22CF92 (Whittle) the Defense stands mute. The Court enters a plea of "Not Guilty" on the Defendant's behalf. 
In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trials.
recess 9:57am

[ae] cases 22CF90 and 22CF92 called 10:56 AM Defendant Bruce D Hady in court. Defendant Jacob L Whittle not in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--no contact with co-defendant or PI 1400
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)
